page.title: 01REVIEW, NE Sutton Coldfield
page.content: This block of land is situated where Birmingham's NE boundary changes into the rural farmland of Warwickshire and Staffordshire. Most of the population lives in that quarter area of the block to the W and SW which is formed of residential housing being the NE part of Sutton Coldfield, a commuter suburb in NE Birmingham. Rail and road links to Birmingham city centre are good. It is regarded at best as an area of middle to upper-middle socio-economic status, well served by schools, having easy access to good shopping facilities locally, in Sutton's "Gracechurch Centre" and in the centre of Birmingham The remaining three quarters of the block which form the central, northern, southern and eastern sections are rural farmland.
